availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Carson Brown (Richland County, Ohio, lt. col. of the 64th OVI)

body.p: Richland County, Ohio, soldier. Virginia native. Son of Robert Brown and Sarah Brown. Farmer in Richland County, Ohio, in 1850. Mustered into Company C of the 64th Ohio Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on October 4, 1861. Appointed captain of Company C on November 27, 1861. Promoted to lieutenant colonel on March 11, 1863. Promoted to Colonel on June 27, 1864. Mustered out on February 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Richland County, Washington, p. 223B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Richland County, Washington, p. 381A.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, vol. 5, 1861-1866 (Akron, OH: The Werner Ptg. and MFG. Co, 1887), 433, 443.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Ohio, Application #279826, Certificate #203797.
"Robert Carson Brown (1834-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #10350739, accessed November 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/10350739.
